dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Alright, so, um, big news this week for Tesla, right? Morgan Stanley's Adam Jonas, he's, like, a long-time bull on the company, had some pretty positive things to say.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Alright, so, um, big news this week for Tesla, right? Morgan Stanley's Adam Jonas, he's, like, a long-time bull on the company, had some pretty positive things to say.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Morgan Stanley equity analyst Adam Jonas, a long-time Tesla bull whos grown increasingly bearish, discussed concerns about the company in a nearly one-hour call with investors that was recorded and leaked online Wednesday.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, a leaked call with investors, actually. And he's saying, you know, demand for Teslas is *surging*. And, uh, sales in China are totally exceeding expectations.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, a leaked call with investors, actually. And he's saying, you know, demand for Teslas is surging. And, uh, sales in China are totally exceeding expectations.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Issues include signs that demand for Teslas electric cars is slipping, sales in China may not be as robust as hoped...

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Right, and the upcoming Model Y crossover is super anticipated. Plus, they're seeing successes with cost and debt, which is, [interrupts] like, a huge turnaround from late 2018.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right, and the upcoming Model Y crossover is super anticipated. Plus, they're seeing successes with cost and debt, which is, like, a huge turnaround from late twenty eighteen.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: As recently as late 2018, Tesla was seen as a growth story, Jonas said on the call. Today, supply exceeds demand, they're burning cash. Nobody cares about the Model Y. Tesla is not seen as a growth story... it's seen more as a distressed credit story and restructuring story.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Oh, for sure. He literally said it was seen as a "failing story" then. Now? Supply lags demand, they're gaining cash. Everyone cares about the Model Y.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh, for sure. He literally said it was seen as a failing story then. Now? Supply lags demand, they're gaining cash. Everyone cares about the Model Y.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: As recently as late 2018, Tesla was seen as a growth story, Jonas said on the call. Today, supply exceeds demand, they're burning cash. Nobody cares about the Model Y.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: He even raised his best-case price for Tesla shares. The stock actually soared like 6% on Wednesday, up 42% this year alone. That's, uh, pretty wild.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: He even raised his best-case price for Tesla shares. The stock actually soared like six percent on Wednesday, up forty two percent this year alone. That's, uh, pretty wild.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The leaked comments come on the heels of a research note this week in which Jonas slashed his worst-case price for Tesla shares to just $10... The stock plunged 6% in Nasdaq trading on Wednesday to $192.73, its lowest since December 2016. Tesla is down 42% this year.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: It *is* wild. And, you know, they returned to the black in Q1, with higher-than-forecast deliveries for the S, X, and 3.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: It is wild. And, you know, they returned to the black in Q one, with higher-than-forecast deliveries for the S, X, and three.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Tesla fell back into the red in the first quarter, hit by lower than forecast deliveries of Model S, X and 3 electric cars.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: So, like, everything's coming up Tesla, then? But wait, didn't they just fail to raise $2.7 billion this month? And Morgan Stanley, Jonas's own firm, avoided participating?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So, like, everything's coming up Tesla, then? But wait, didn't they just fail to raise two point seven billion dollars this month? And Morgan Stanley, Jonas's own firm, avoided participating?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Jonass tough outlook also comes just after Tesla raised $2.7 billion this month in its latest debt and equity offering. Curiously, Morgan Stanley was among the investment banks participating in the sale of those offerings.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: [overlapping] Yeah, that's the kicker, isn't it? It's, uh, quite a juxtaposition. Jonas *did* note they capitalized on an opportunity to raise funds late last year when things looked weaker.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, that's the kicker, isn't it? It's, uh, quite a juxtaposition. Jonas did note they capitalized on an opportunity to raise funds late last year when things looked weaker.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: In his discussion, Jonas noted that Tesla passed up an opportunity to raise funds late last year when its finances briefly looked stronger.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: So he's optimistic, but his firm isn't backing the latest capital raise? That feels, like, a little contradictory, no?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So he's optimistic, but his firm isn't backing the latest capital raise? That feels, like, a little contradictory, no?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Well, he mentioned they weren't looking for "strategic involvement" this time, just institutional investors. But, um, yeah, it definitely adds a layer of complexity.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Well, he mentioned they weren't looking for strategic involvement this time, just institutional investors. But, um, yeah, it definitely adds a layer of complexity.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: We were thinking they would raise capital but felt there was a very high likelihood that there would be a strategic involvement, someone to fill the board, provide some know-how and some vision in addition to the Tesla vision. Instead, they are raising capital near the lows, no strategic buy-in, he said. It was all institutional.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: And the Q1 sales, he said they "skyrocketed" but then the Q2 "whisper number" is, like, lower than their target?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And the Q one sales, he said they skyrocketed but then the Q two whisper number is, like, lower than their target?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Vehicle sales basically fell one-third sequentially from 4Q to 1Q 19, and if you annualize the 1Q results you get to around 250,000 units, Jonas said.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Exactly. He said Q1 annualized would be around 250,000 units, way above their own high-end target. But then Q2, they're targeting 90-100k, and the whisper is, like, mid-70s.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Exactly. He said Q one annualized would be around two hundred fifty thousand units, way above their own high-end target. But then Q two, they're targeting ninety-100k, and the whisper is, like, mid-seventy seconds.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: That's more than 100,000 units below the low end of the company's 360,000 to 400,000 target for deliveries this year.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Hmm. So, a lot of positive momentum, huge turnaround, but still some, uh, head-scratching moments with the financials.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Hmm. So, a lot of positive momentum, huge turnaround, but still some, uh, head-scratching moments with the financials.

dialogue_turns.text: Pretty much. It's never boring with Tesla, is it? Still a success story in many ways, but with these, you know, underlying questions.
